data.title: Kelly Ann Stewart on LinkedIn: #railconnectivity #crossborderrail #euasean
data.meta_description: Pictures from the 7-8 May 2024 EU-ASEAN Workshop on Seamless Railway Operations with a focus on Singapore-Kunming Rail Line (SKRL) and a common traffic…
data.text:
📌 Finnish ETCS Level 2 Test Installation Goes Live 🚇 #Hitachi Rail has successfully implemented #ETCS Level 2, marking a significant milestone for Finland's rail infrastructure 🔍 Key Points - ETCS Level 2 installed on Kouvola - Kotka/Hamina line - 5G radio communications system conforming #FRMCS - Additional #interlocking renewal completed in November 2023 - The project was completed under a 2021 contract awarded to #Thales’ Ground Transportation Systems - The line will be used as a test track to test the signaling technology This development is poised to significantly advance Finland's rail signaling capabilities and pave the way for further implementations of ETCS Level 2 across the country. Source: Rail Journal #RailwayTechnology #Infrastructure #RailCommunications #ERTMS _ _ _ 👍 Like if you find value, re-post ♻️, and follow for more interesting tech, and innovation insights.

Emergency Stop Plungers (ESP) : are used in different Railway transportation systems to protect platform areas in stations from moving trains in case of accidents around passenger platform areas,ESP should be installed on each platform in different location to alert staff to prevent a train from arriving at or leaving the station ,The button is protected with a structure that avoids any activation by mistake When pushing the button, so its better for passengers to be aware when we need to use ESP and for what to avoid any disruption or fine from the Local authorities. #signalling #railindustry #safty #monorail #interface #coordination #ESP #emergencyStopPlunger #Opreation For more informations about railway industry #Follow ⬇️ 👈 Below picture from #MRT Singapore 🇸🇬

Indonesia’s President Joko ‘Jokowi’ Widodo urged regional leaders to build MRT systems using their regional budgets. As he stated in the opening of the national working meeting of the Association of Indonesian Municipal Government (Apeksi), “I challenge regional government capable of constructing high-cost mas transportation systems, such as Mass Rapid Transit (MRT), Light Rapid Transit (LRT), or high-speed trains with regional budgets. Please coordinate with the Minister of Transportation if the regional budget is sufficient. For example, it can be a 50-50 split, 50% from the regional and 50% from the national budgets. Because if not, in 10-20 years, all cities will be congested,” Read more at https://buff.ly/3VdIOZF #news #LatestNews #Jokowi #MRT #LRT #transportation

🚂 《《D̳I̳G̳I̳T̳A̳L̳ ̳R̳A̳I̳L̳W̳A̳Y̳》》 🚂 𝑯𝒊𝒕𝒂𝒄𝒉𝒊 𝑹𝒂𝒊𝒍 is a trusted partner to the world’s best transport organisations. 💯 📍This company is famous for Japan's iconic high speed bullet train🚄, draws on the digital and AI expertise of Hitachi Group companies to accelerate innovation and develop new technologies. Hitachi Rail's mission in the project was to implement the 𝗳𝗶𝗿𝘀𝘁 𝗘𝗧𝗖𝗦 𝗟𝟮 𝘁𝗿𝗶𝗮𝗹 𝘁𝗿𝗮𝗰𝗸 𝗶𝗻 𝗙𝗶𝗻𝗹𝗮𝗻𝗱, utilizing cutting-edge technology to enhance railway safety and efficiency. The 𝙁𝙪𝙩𝙪𝙧𝙚 𝙍𝙖𝙙𝙞𝙤 𝙈𝙤𝙗𝙞𝙡𝙚 𝘾𝙤𝙢𝙢𝙪𝙣𝙞𝙘𝙖𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣 𝙎𝙮𝙨𝙩𝙚𝙢 (𝙁𝙍𝙈𝘾𝙎) is the Railways response for two elements of strategic importance for the future of the railways: 💡First – the fast-coming GSM-R obsolescence, which is European level risk for Railways ERTMS continuity (2035); 💡Second - it is also a significant opportunity, which is to enable and support the 𝑹𝒂𝒊𝒍𝒘𝒂𝒚𝒔 𝑫𝒊𝒈𝒊𝒕𝒂𝒍𝒊𝒛𝒂𝒕𝒊𝒐𝒏, and therefore the need to transmit, receive and use increasing volumes of data, which is at the very heart of sustainable transport. 𝗵𝘁𝘁𝗽𝘀://𝘆𝗼𝘂𝘁𝘂.𝗯𝗲/𝗥𝟰𝘃𝗶𝗘𝗫𝗱𝟮𝗩𝘇𝗨 #HitachiRail #Innovation #Digital #NewConcept #ETCS #5G

Interoperability, as the cornerstone of seamless operation, encourages various stakeholders in the railway transport to unify their rules, technology, and procedures, allowing diverse services to function effectively and accept services from other systems. 🌐 In the context of the trans-European railway system, this means ensuring the safe and uninterrupted transport of trains while maintaining the required level of track capacity utility. 🛤 Q Techna d.o.o. plays a crucial role in this landscape as it holds authorization as: ✅ the Notified Body (NoBo) for the conformity assessment of technical specifications for interoperability, ✅ the Designated Body (DeBo) for ensuring conformity with the national rules of the Republic of Slovenia. Discover more about our contributions to the interoperability of the rail system at 🌐 https://lnkd.in/eexzny_z. #interoperability #railwaysystem #nebo #debo #qtechna #powerofparnership

Opportunity for Collaborative Railway Technology Development: Japan, with its advanced railway technology, can collaborate with Singapore in leveraging the Singapore Rail Test Centre (SRTC) for joint research and development projects. This collaboration could involve testing Japanese high-speed trains and systems in the SRTC's controlled environment, providing valuable insights and contributing to the enhancement of railway technologies. The partnership could extend beyond testing to knowledge exchange and skill development, allowing Japanese rail professionals to collaborate with their Singaporean counterparts. This cross-cultural collaboration could result in the development of cutting-edge railway systems that meet the specific needs of both countries. Regional Testing Hub and Knowledge Exchange: Japan and Singapore can explore the potential of establishing the SRTC as a regional testing hub for railway technology. This would involve inviting neighboring countries, including India, to utilize the facilities for testing and integrating their rail systems, fostering regional cooperation and knowledge exchange in the field of rail infrastructure. The SRTC's ambition to serve as a training ground for rail professionals presents an opportunity for Japanese experts to share their expertise with aspiring professionals from Singapore and other regional partners. This collaborative approach can contribute to the development of a skilled workforce capable of supporting the growth of railway networks in the Asia-Pacific region.
